intro: Cayaponia bonariensis var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
